climbs.name: Zombie Leprachauns
climbs.fa: Equipped by Charlie Kardalef,  FA: Mike Snyder, 2011

content.description: This climb is fairly sustained, without ever really having a 5.12- move.  There are a few good rests and mini cruxes the whole way.  A very good CK route.
content.location: Left of Insane Hound Posse, right of Wall of Denial.

content.description: Starts on desperate-for-the-grade edges in a cold corner and works up and slightly out on the face on increasingly better pockets to the anchors.
content.location: Hiding in perpetual shade, Winged Lizard is the sole climb on the north-facing, micro wall just uphill and around the corner (to climber's right) from the obvious gash that is the Death Flake from Hell.

climbs.name: Wall Of Denial
climbs.fa: Equipped by Stan Price,  FA: Alli Rainey??

content.description: Good sustained edge climbing with a definitive crux about 5 bolts up.  At 90' the angle eases a bit but continues for another 60 feet using a crack system.
content.protection: 18 bolts,  carabiners on anchor.  (Thank god!  I had run out of draws and was  back cleaning for half the route!)  80 meter rope may stretch to the ground.  Otherwise lower twice off leaver on bolt 8 or so.
content.location: Center of Wall of Denial Wall.  The Loooooong one.

content.description: The bolts are well spaced at the bottom, then gradually become closer together as you go up and the route gets easier.  Hard right from the get go though as with most SP routes theres a bolt waiting  right when you finally find a hold you could possibly clip from.  Good but demanding climbing down low and very prickly climbing toward the end.  Hmmm
content.location: The left most route on the Wall Of Denial Wall.

content.description: The name says it all, and this is definitely one of the best!  Nine Pins shares the first 3 bolt with this route but where Nine Pins goes left continue straight up.  Vertical climbing leads you to an incredible crux sequence and then a nice edge with an anchor
content.location: This route is easily located by just following the cold air to the refrigerator chimney.  Once at the Chimney just look at the right hand wall.

content.description: crux is the first three bolts.  its a flake so if your good at flakes then you'll be alright, after that it jugs out to the anchors and i do mean jugs out!
content.location: shares first 3 bolts with save the best for last and then angles left

content.description: An old SP route that, along with Wall of Denial and Speak of The Devil, was the only thing here for a long time.  This route is devious and hard and unfortunately never has much chalk on it which makes it even more fun to solve.  This route is probably why Bosephus is so sandbagged.
content.location: Just left of Bosephus and the leftmost route on the black and purple streaked wall.

content.description: This is a great warm-up route with steep climbing from bottom to top on big holds.  Start by climbing a broken up flake and then continue up the face to a sidepull crack that ends at the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  I think there were 8 bolts.
content.location: This route is located just to the left of a large crack and dihedral (bolted 5.9 follows the right side of the crack).  It will be right in front of you when you crest the small hill on the trail.

content.description: Just to the right of “Bosephus” climbs the dark streaks up on good small edges and small pockets.
content.location: Just to the right from the Denial Wall.

content.description: Make your way up one super fun move at a time. Don't expect to get up it without using real rock climbing technique. The holds are hard to find on the onsight, as this route is pretty new and does not have any chalk beta, however, every hold is excellent through out the entire route once you find them. Some prefer to climb up the arete towards the top, others prefer staying on the face using pockets and crimps. Give it a try! definitely one to climb in the area if you like vertical technical climbing. Bonus: on a hot day, this route is actually next to an air conditioning crack that drops the temperature easily by 30 degrees. Belayers, bring your jackets!
content.location: One of the first routes you see as you approach the crag. Hard to miss, after making your way up the steep switchbacks that are baking in the sun, you get hit with an amazing air conditioning breeze coming out of a large crack on your right.

content.description: Great climb! Pockets, cracks, over hung and long though not as sustained as other climbs, but basically you're getting Ten Sleep's jewels here.  5.10's here seem to be more about sustained pump than a "hard move".  Although I seem to recall the crack/flack feature at the top being most difficult, perhaps, because the pump set in.
content.location: On the Denial Wall just left of the obtuse dihedral in the center of the entire wall.  Fifth climb in from the left.   To the right of Insane Hound Posse.

content.description: Just right of ”Family Tradition”  Looks like fun. Although I haven’t done it yet. Ill update the description when I do…

This route is short but the climbing is excellent and well worth the effort. Hard moves get you started right off the ground and stay sustained and bouldery till you pull through the crux.  The upper third of the route has bigger holds but still keeps you on your toes.
content.location: Bosephus can be found on the short face to the right of Insane Hound Posse.  It's the route in the center of the face.
